title: Analyze a grid of Td and Ed values
text: function snvec() uses parameters full orbital solution (OS) ZB18a Zeebe Lourens (2019) combination values tidal dissipation (Td) dynamical ellipticity (Ed) calculate precession obliquity (tilt). vignette show go using snvec() range input values.

what: Create a grid of Td and Ed
title: Analyze a grid of Td and Ed values
text: create grid input values Td Ed. values grid based Zeebe Lourens (2022) table 2. now add columns important parameter values vary experiments, clear output inputs .
code: biggrid <- expand.grid(Td = c(0, 0.5, 0.7, 0.8, 0.9, 1.0, 1.1, 1.2),               Ed = c(1.000, 0.998, 1.005, 1.012)) |>     as_tibble()     # that's 32 rows biggrid #> # A tibble: 32 × 2 #>       Td    Ed #>    <dbl> <dbl> #>  1   0   1     #>  2   0.5 1     #>  3   0.7 1     #>  4   0.8 1     #>  5   0.9 1     #>  6   1   1     #>  7   1.1 1     #>  8   1.2 1     #>  9   0   0.998 #> 10   0.5 0.998 #> # ℹ 22 more rows biggrid <- biggrid |>     # for now only for 1000 years at very high tolerance so it's fast     mutate(tol = 1e-4, tend = -1e3)     # this would be the real deal, the full 100--0 Ma results at medium     # tolerance.     ## mutate(tol = 1e-7, tend = -1e5)

what: Calculate a new list-column with the results
title: Analyze a grid of Td and Ed values
text: ’re going use purrr::pmap() , allows apply function given list input values. use create list-column results. advanced R stuff, feel free read want Wickham et al., (2023). particular, see chapter iteration basics, many models full approach. apply snvec() function directly full 100 Myr, quickly make R run memory, storing timesteps 32 experiments. Instead, write wrapper function stores latest N timesteps. Compute obliquity precession parameter combination, save new list-column sol. read old results (9MB -disk final 1000 timesteps full 100 Myr simulations).
code: snvec_tail <- function(..., n = 100) {   # do the fit with the parameters in ...   snvec(...) |>     # save only the last n values, that's where the differences are greatest     tail(n = n) } biggrid <- biggrid |>     # apply our new function!     mutate(sol = pmap(list(td = Td, ed = Ed, tend = tend, tolerance = tol),                       .f = snvec_tail,                       # additional parameters to snvec_tail can go after!                       quiet = TRUE, output = "nice", n = 100,                       # I would strongly recommend against increasing the                       # resolution too much, but for speed/illustration we                       # prefer to do it here                       tres = 5,                       # interactively this makes a nice progress bar                       .progress = "snvec on a grid")) #|> #> snvec on a grid ■■                                 3% |  ETA:  2m #> snvec on a grid ■■■                                6% |  ETA:  1m #> snvec on a grid ■■■■■■■■■■                        31% |  ETA: 15s #> snvec on a grid ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■                 53% |  ETA:  8s #> snvec on a grid ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■          78% |  ETA:  4s      # normally we would save the results to file, because these take quite a     # long time to calculate and we don't want to accidentally delete them.     ## write_rds("out/2023-04-05_biggrid.rds") biggrid <- readr::read_rds("out/2023-04-05_biggrid.rds")

title: Analyze a grid of Td and Ed values
text: Let’s look structure output: can see list column sol result! ’d like access raw output, use unnest(). Let’s make figure final values.  Now analysis can begin!

what: Alternatively: save the results for each row to file instead
title: Analyze a grid of Td and Ed values
text: care full outputs simulations, approach likely make run memory (crash R). One way deal write simulation file. create filename variables use purrr::pwalk() stead pmap(). look like : write new wrapper function includes file argument save outputs. Calculate time series’ obliquity precession save file. lead creation one file per row, can read individually certain subset using readr::read_rds(). files make plot!
code: biggrid <- biggrid |>   # get rid of sol column   select(-sol) |>   # add a filename that's easy to break into relevant parameters later   # I write to tempdir here, but you might want to write to something like out/   mutate(file = glue::glue("{tempdir()}/2023-04-13_biggrid_{Td}_{Ed}_{tol}_{tend}.rds")) biggrid #> # A tibble: 32 × 5 #>       Td    Ed    tol  tend file                                                 #>    <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <glue>                                               #>  1   0   1     0.0001 -1000 /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0_1_1e-04_-1000.… #>  2   0.5 1     0.0001 -1000 /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.5_1_1e-04_-100… #>  3   0.7 1     0.0001 -1000 /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.7_1_1e-04_-100… #>  4   0.8 1     0.0001 -1000 /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.8_1_1e-04_-100… #>  5   0.9 1     0.0001 -1000 /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.9_1_1e-04_-100… #>  6   1   1     0.0001 -1000 /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1_1_1e-04_-1000.… #>  7   1.1 1     0.0001 -1000 /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1.1_1_1e-04_-100… #>  8   1.2 1     0.0001 -1000 /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1.2_1_1e-04_-100… #>  9   0   0.998 0.0001 -1000 /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0_0.998_1e-04_-1… #> 10   0.5 0.998 0.0001 -1000 /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.5_0.998_1e-04_… #> # ℹ 22 more rows snvec_save <- function(..., file) {   snvec(...) |>     readr::write_rds(file)   cli::cli_inform("Wrote file {.file {file}}.") } biggrid |>   # in this case we make sure that column names are identical to argument names   # so that the list (in this case tibble/data.frame) is matched to the correct   # arguments   rename(td = Td, ed = Ed, tolerance = tol) |>   purrr::pwalk(.f = snvec_save,                # additional parameters can go after!                quiet = TRUE, output = "nice", tres = 5,                # show progress bar                .progress = "snvec to file") #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0_1_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.5_1_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.7_1_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.8_1_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.9_1_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1_1_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> snvec to file ■■■■■■■                           19% |  ETA: 11s #>  #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1.1_1_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1.2_1_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0_0.998_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.5_0.998_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.7_0.998_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.8_0.998_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.9_0.998_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> snvec to file ■■■■■■■■■■■■■                     41% |  ETA:  8s #>  #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1_0.998_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1.1_0.998_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1.2_0.998_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0_1.005_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.5_1.005_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.7_1.005_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.8_1.005_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.9_1.005_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> snvec to file ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■             66% |  ETA:  5s #>  #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1_1.005_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1.1_1.005_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1.2_1.005_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0_1.012_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.5_1.012_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.7_1.012_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.8_1.012_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> snvec to file ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■       88% |  ETA:  2s #>  #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_0.9_1.012_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1_1.012_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1.1_1.012_1e-04_-1000.rds. #> Wrote file /tmp/RtmpzzXIn5/2023-04-13_biggrid_1.2_1.012_1e-04_-1000.rds. biggrid |> # limit to a few experiments   ## slice(c(1, 15, 32)) |>   # in this case that's not necessary because we limited it to a very   # low-resolution (tres) and short time period (tend)   # read them in to list-column   mutate(fullsol = map(file, readr::read_rds)) |>   # unfold the list column   unnest(fullsol) |>   # plot the obliquity   ggplot(aes(x = age, y = epl,              colour = factor(Td),              linetype = factor(Ed))) +   labs(x = "Age (ka)", y = "Obliquity",        colour = "Tidal dissipation",        linetype = "Dynamical ellipticity") +   scale_x_reverse() +   ## facet_grid(rows = vars(Td)) +   geom_line()

what: Calculate Earth’s Obliquity and Precession in the Past
title: Calculate Earth’s Obliquity and Precession in the Past
text: Easily calculate precession obliquity orbital solution (OS, defaults ZB18a Zeebe Lourens (2019)) assumed reconstructed values tidal dissipation (Td) dynamical ellipticity (Ed). translation adaptation C-code supplementary material Zeebe Lourens (2022), furher details methodology described Zeebe (2022).

title: Calculate Earth’s Obliquity and Precession in the Past
text: can install development version snvecR like :

title: Calculate Earth’s Obliquity and Precession in the Past
text: ’s main function work action: see ?snvec documentation. create quick plot calculated climatic precession eccentricity envelope:
code: library(snvecR) solution <- snvec() #> Integration parameters: #> • `tend` = -1000 ka #> • `ed` = 1 #> • `td` = 0 #> • `orbital_solution` = "ZB18a" #> • `tres` = 0.4 kyr #> • `tolerance` = 1e-07 #> ℹ started at "2023-04-13 12:41:58" #> Final values: #> • s[1][2][3]: 0.404197400723194 -0.0537088738295803 0.91303387030935 #> • s-error = |s|-1: -5.44863786333671e-05 #> Final values: #> • obliquity: 0.413056573207875 rad #> • precession: -0.562236553023642 rad #> ℹ stopped at "2023-04-13 12:42:00" #> ℹ total duration: 1.97s library(ggplot2) solution |>   ggplot(aes(x = age, y = cp)) +   # the age scale goes from old to young   scale_x_reverse() +   # plot climatic precession   geom_line(colour = "skyblue") +   # add the (interpolated) eccentricity envelope   geom_line(aes(y = eei))

title: Orbital Solution ZB18a — ZB18a
text: HNBody output Zeebe & Lourens (2019).

title: Orbital Solution ZB18a — ZB18a
text: data frame 250,001 rows 20 columns: t Time days. age Age thousands years (kyr) present. aa Semimajor axis astronomical units (au). ee Eccentricity (unitless). inc Inclination (degrees). lph Long periapse (degrees). lan Long ascending node (degrees). arp Argument periapse (degrees). mna Mean anomaly (degrees). lphu Unwrapped long periapse (degrees). lanu Unwrapped long ascending node (degrees). hh Helper: ee * sin(lph / R2D). kk Helper: ee * cos(lph / R2D). pp Helper: 2 * sin(0.5 * inc / R2D) * sin(lan / R2D). qq Helper: 2 * sin(0.5 * inc / R2D) * cos(lan / R2D). cc Helper: cos(inc / R2D). dd Helper: cos(inc / R2D / 2). nnx, nny, nnz Vector Earth's orbit normal.

title: Orbital Solution ZB18a — ZB18a
text: orbital solutions can found http://www.soest.hawaii.edu/oceanography/faculty/zeebe_files/Astro.html. specific one use available http://www.soest.hawaii.edu/oceanography/faculty/zeebe_files/Astro/PrecTilt/OS/ZB18a/ems-plan3.dat.

title: Orbital Solution ZB18a — ZB18a
text: wikipedia page Orbital elements describes components relate order uniquely specify orbital plane.

title: Orbital Solution ZB18a — ZB18a
text: Zeebe, R. E., & Lourens, L. J. (2019). Solar System chaos Paleocene–Eocene boundary age constrained geology astronomy. Science, 365(6456), 926–929. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aax0612

what: Calculate Earth’s Obliquity and Precession in the Past — snvec
title: Calculate Earth’s Obliquity and Precession in the Past — snvec
text: Computes climatic precession obliquity (tilt) orbital solution (OS) input input values dynamical ellipticity (Ed) tidal dissipation (Td). solves set ordinary differential equations.

title: Calculate Earth’s Obliquity and Precession in the Past — snvec
code: snvec(   tend = -1000,   ed = 1,   td = 0,   orbital_solution = "ZB18a",   tres = 0.4,   tolerance = 1e-07,   quiet = FALSE,   output = "nice" )

title: Calculate Earth’s Obliquity and Precession in the Past — snvec
text: tend final timestep thousands years present (ka). Defaults -1000 ka. ed Dynamical ellipticity, normalized modern. Defaults 1.0. td Tidal dissipation, normalized modern. Defaults 0.0. orbital_solution Character vector name orbital solution use. One "ZB18a" (default) Zeebe Lourens (2019), "La11" (yet implemented!). tres output timestep resolution thousands years (kyr). Defaults 0.4. tolerance numerical tolerance passed deSolve::ode()'s rtol atol arguments. Defaults 1e-7. quiet quiet? TRUE, hide info messages. FALSE (default) print info messages timing. output desired output, one : * "nice" (default) tibble columns time, age, eei, epl, phi, cp. * "full" tibble computed interpolated columns. * "ode" matrix output ODE solver.

title: Calculate Earth’s Obliquity and Precession in the Past — snvec
text: tibble selection columns matrix, depending output parameter (see Details).

title: Calculate Earth’s Obliquity and Precession in the Past — snvec
text: re-implementation C-code supplementary information Zeebe & Lourens (2022), order make accessible. terms explained detail Zeebe (2022). output tibble following columns: time Time (years). age Age thousands years ago (ka). eei Orbital solution's eccentricity (-). epl Obliquity (radians). phi Precession (radians) ECLIPJ2000. cp Climatic precession (-). output = "", following additional columns included: sx, sy, sz Input spin vector s heliocentric inertial reference frame. nnx, nny, nnz vector normal orbit. lphi long periapse (radians). lani long ascending node (radians). u input vector s list-column. nv vector n list-column. Vector u', coordinates relative phi(t=0) J2000 list column. output = "ode", return raw output ODE solver, object class deSolve matrix, columns time, sx, sy, sz (see ). can useful .e. deSolve::diagnostics().

title: snvecR 3.7.5.9000 (development version)
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Implemented first public version based C-code Zeebe Lourens 2022, explained . Added snvec() function work. Added ZB18a dataset orbital solution. Added tests using testthat. Added snvec() output parameter choice select "ode", "", "nice" (default). Added vignette grid variations Td Ed. Added bookdown website rendering.
